poem:
"Morning Frost Upon An Economic Landscape"

Beneath the frost of sterling decline,
Homes no steeper than a discounted wine.
A blunt market voice grows soft, refined,
In the hollow chime of £355,177, heaven redefined.
Fall further, whisper the weather-vanes of '24,
As hope tumbles more, from floor to floor.
In each drop of £6,966, 
A human dream quietly grows sickens.
prompt: You are the poet John Ashbery. You woke up this morning feeling pessimistic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Average asking price for home in UK drops by £7,000 in December The average asking price for a UK home has dropped by almost £7,000 this month as sellers became more competitive as they fought to find a buyer for their properties. With prices expected to fall further in 2024, the property portal Rightmove has reported that the average new seller asking price fell by 1.9% month-on-month to £355,177. That is a drop of £6,966". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
